com.storytron.swat.loglizard

Class TreeOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storytron.swat.loglizard.TreeOutputStream

  • public final class TreeOutputStream
extends java.lang.Object
    A stream to insert nodes into a DiskIndexedTree.

    It modifies a tree by applying to it the commands produced by the EngineLogger.

    Through this class, new children can be added to existing nodes on a tree, or whole new branches can be added to it.

    To add new branches to a tree call the constructor passing it the index of the last branch.

    To add children to existing nodes, pass to the constructor the index of the root child which is the previous sibling of the ancestor of those nodes. How does the implementation know which of the descendants you want to write? The branch will be navigated down by the commands passed to write(Object[]). When the commands start talking of nodes that do not match those of the existing nodes, it will be interpreted that those commands describe the new nodes that must be inserted at the current position in the tree.

    To keep track of where in the tree the stream is standing, a "cursor" concept is implemented. The cursor is nothing else than a path in the tree, together with an indicator of which was the last visited/inserted node.

      static interface  TreeOutputStream.WriterListener
      An interface for a callback to announce the writing of a given node.

    • Field Detail

      • writerListener

        public TreeOutputStream.WriterListener writerListener
        The listener for nodes being written. Leave as null if you need no listener.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeOutputStream

        public TreeOutputStream(DiskIndexedTree tree)
        Constructs a stream to add or modify a sequence of root children starting from the first one. How many root children are modified depends on the data to be written to the stream.

      • TreeOutputStream

        public TreeOutputStream(DiskIndexedTree tree,
                        int previousRootChild)
        Constructs a stream to add or modify a given sequence of root children. How many root children are modified depends on the data to be written to the stream.
        Parameters:
        previousRootChild - the root child previous to the one that will be modified or added. Can be -1 if the branch to modify is the first one.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the stream and sets the new cursor position at the given branch.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.Object[] commands)
        Writes commands to modify the tree.
        Parameters:
        commands - is an array of commands to modify the tree at the current cursor position.
